00001 // pVec.h - yet another 3D vector class.
00002 //
00003 // Copyright 1997-2006 by David K. McAllister
00004 // Based on code Copyright 1997 by Jonathan P. Leech
00005 //
00006 // A simple 3D float vector class for internal use by the particle systems.
00007 //
00008 // The new implementation of this class uses four floats. This allows the class to be implemented using
00009 // SSE intrinsics for faster execution on P4 and AMD processors.
00010 
00011 #ifndef _pvec_h
00012 #define _pvec_h
00013 
00014 #include <iostream>
00015 
00016 #include <math.h>
00017 
00018 #ifndef M_PI
00019 #define M_PI 3.1415926535897932384626433f
00020 #endif
00021 
00022 #ifdef WIN32
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 // This is because their stupid compiler thinks it's smart.
00025 #define inline __forceinline
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 namespace PAPI
00029 {
00030     const float P_SQRT2PI = 2.506628274631000502415765284811045253006f;
00031     const float P_ONEOVERSQRT2PI = (1.f / P_SQRT2PI);
00032 
00033     inline float fsqr(float f) { return f * f; }
00034 
00035 #ifdef unix
00036     inline float pRandf() { return drand48(); }
00037     inline void pSRandf(int x) { srand48(x); }
00038 #else
00039     const float P_ONEOVER_RAND_MAX = (1.0f/((float) RAND_MAX));
00040     inline float pRandf() { return ((float) rand())*P_ONEOVER_RAND_MAX; }
00041     inline void pSRandf(int x) { srand(x); }
00042 #endif
00043 
00044     inline bool pSameSign(const float &a, const float &b) { return a * b >= 0.0f; }
00045     inline bool pSameSignd(const float &a, const float &b)
00046     {
00047         int *fi = (int *)&a;
00048         int *gi = (int *)&b;
00049         return !(((*fi) ^ (*gi)) & 0x80000000);
00050     }
00051 
00053     inline float pNRandf(float sigma = 1.0f)
00054     {
00055         const float P_ONE_OVER_SIGMA_EXP = (1.0f / 0.7975f);
00056 
00057         if(sigma == 0) return 0;
00058 
00059         float y;
00060         do {
00061             y = -logf(pRandf());
00062         }
00063         while(pRandf() > expf(-fsqr(y - 1.0f)*0.5f));
00064 
00065         if(rand() & 0x1)
00066             return y * sigma * P_ONE_OVER_SIGMA_EXP;
00067         else
00068             return -y * sigma * P_ONE_OVER_SIGMA_EXP;
00069     }
00070 
00076     class pVec
00077     {
00078         float vx, vy, vz;
00079 
00080     public:
00081         inline pVec(float ax, float ay, float az) : vx(ax), vy(ay), vz(az) {}
00082         inline pVec(float a) : vx(a), vy(a), vz(a) {}
00083         inline pVec() {}
00084 
00085         const float& x() const { return vx; }
00086         const float& y() const { return vy; }
00087         const float& z() const { return vz; }
00088 
00089         float& x() { return vx; }
00090         float& y() { return vy; }
00091         float& z() { return vz; }
00092 
00093         inline float length() const
00094         {
00095             return sqrtf(vx*vx+vy*vy+vz*vz);
00096         }
00097 
00098         inline float length2() const
00099         {
00100             return (vx*vx+vy*vy+vz*vz);
00101         }
00102 
00103         inline float normalize()
00104         {
00105             float onel = 1.0f / sqrtf(vx*vx+vy*vy+vz*vz);
00106             vx *= onel;
00107             vy *= onel;
00108             vz *= onel;
00109 
00110             return onel;
00111         }
00112 
00113         // Dot product
00114         friend inline float dot(const pVec &a, const pVec &b)
00115         {
00116             return b.x()*a.x() + b.y()*a.y() + b.z()*a.z();
00117         }
00118 
00119         // Scalar multiply
00120         inline pVec operator*(const float s) const
00121         {
00122             return pVec(vx*s, vy*s, vz*s);
00123         }
00124 
00125         inline pVec operator/(const float s) const
00126         {
00127             float invs = 1.0f / s;
00128             return pVec(vx*invs, vy*invs, vz*invs);
00129         }
00130 
00131         inline pVec operator+(const pVec& a) const
00132         {
00133             return pVec(vx+a.x(), vy+a.y(), vz+a.z());
00134         }
00135 
00136         inline pVec operator-(const pVec& a) const
00137         {
00138             return pVec(vx-a.x(), vy-a.y(), vz-a.z());
00139         }
00140 
00141         inline bool operator==(const pVec &a) const
00142         {
00143             return vx==a.x() && vy==a.y() && vz==a.z();
00144         }
00145 
00146         inline pVec operator-()
00147         {
00148             vx = -vx;
00149             vy = -vy;
00150             vz = -vz;
00151             return *this;
00152         }
00153 
00154         inline pVec& operator+=(const pVec& a)
00155         {
00156             vx += a.x();
00157             vy += a.y();
00158             vz += a.z();
00159             return *this;
00160         }
00161 
00162         inline pVec& operator-=(const pVec& a)
00163         {
00164             vx -= a.x();
00165             vy -= a.y();
00166             vz -= a.z();
00167             return *this;
00168         }
00169 
00170         inline pVec& operator*=(const float a)
00171         {
00172             vx *= a;
00173             vy *= a;
00174             vz *= a;
00175             return *this;
00176         }
00177 
00178         inline pVec& operator/=(const float a)
00179         {
00180             float b = 1.0f / a;
00181             vx *= b;
00182             vy *= b;
00183             vz *= b;
00184             return *this;
00185         }
00186 
00187         inline pVec& operator=(const pVec& a)
00188         {
00189             vx = a.x();
00190             vy = a.y();
00191             vz = a.z();
00192             return *this;
00193         }
00194 
00195         // Component-wise absolute value
00196         friend inline pVec Abs(const pVec &a)
00197         {
00198             return pVec(fabs(a.x()), fabs(a.y()), fabs(a.z()));
00199         }
00200 
00201         // Component-wise multiply
00202         friend inline pVec CompMult(const pVec &a, const pVec& b)
00203         {
00204             return pVec(b.x()*a.x(), b.y()*a.y(), b.z()*a.z());
00205         }
00206 
00207         friend inline pVec Cross(const pVec& a, const pVec& b)
00208         {
00209             return pVec(
00210                 a.y()*b.z()-a.z()*b.y(),
00211                 a.z()*b.x()-a.x()*b.z(),
00212                 a.x()*b.y()-a.y()*b.x());
00213         }
00214 
00215         friend inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const pVec& v)
00216         {
00217             os << &v << '[' << v.x() << ", " << v.y() << ", " << v.z() << ']';
00218 
00219             return os;
00220         }
00221     };
00222 
00223     // To offset [0 .. 1] vectors to [-.5 .. .5]
00224     static pVec vHalf(0.5, 0.5, 0.5);
00225 
00226     inline pVec pRandVec()
00227     {
00228         return pVec(pRandf(), pRandf(), pRandf());
00229     }
00230 
00231     inline pVec pNRandVec(float stdev)
00232     {
00233         return pVec(pNRandf(stdev), pNRandf(stdev), pNRandf(stdev));
00234     }
00235 
00236 };
00237 
00238 #endif
